findings.rationale: The broad definition of Confidential Information may lead to disputes regarding what constitutes confidential data, increasing the risk of unintentional breaches.
findings.evidence_quote: Confidential Information includes all proprietary information, trade secrets, business plans, financial data, and technical information disclosed by either party.

findings.rationale: The obligations to maintain confidentiality last only three years, which may not be sufficient for certain types of sensitive information.
findings.evidence_quote: This Agreement shall remain in effect for three (3) years from the date of execution, after which the obligations shall terminate.

findings.rationale: The contract does not specify detailed procedures for returning or destroying Confidential Information, which could lead to non-compliance.
findings.evidence_quote: Upon termination, each party shall return or destroy all Confidential Information received from the other party.

findings.rationale: The choice of Texas as governing law may limit legal recourse options for parties located in different jurisdictions.
